pull.title: CI: Bump vcpkg commit ID to get new msys mirror list
pull.body:
This fixes the appveyor CI job, see #20066.

Currently the job fails because some of the vcpkg dependencies need to install msys2 and the hardcoded mirror in the vcpkg config is down.

Vcpkg commit 76a7e9248fb3c57350b559966dcaa2d52a5e4458 adds new mirrors to the hardcoded list.

committer Aaron Clauson <aaron@sipsorcery.com> 1602008273 +0100

Bump vcpkg commit ID to get new msys mirror list

This fixes the appveyor CI job, see #20066.

Currently the job fails because some of the vcpkg dependencies need to install msys2 and the hardcoded mirror in the vcpkg config is down.

Vcpkg commit 76a7e9248fb3c57350b559966dcaa2d52a5e4458 adds new mirrors to the hardcoded list.

Currently the job fails because some of the vcpkg dependencies need to install msys2 and the hardcoded mirror in the vcpkg config is down.

Vcpkg commit 76a7e9248fb3c57350b559966dcaa2d52a5e4458 adds new mirrors to the hardcoded list.

events.body:
ACK c83155b406b849a1589d22c34843cc883897431d

`VCPKG_COMMIT_ID: '40230b8e3f6368dcb398d649331be878ca1e9007'` refers to this version of the `vcpkg` tree: https://github.com/microsoft/vcpkg/tree/40230b8e3f6368dcb398d649331be878ca1e9007
utACK c83155b406b849a1589d22c34843cc883897431d. Verified that 40230b8e3f6368dcb398d649331be878ca1e9007 is a recent commit in the https://github.com/microsoft/vcpkg repository's master branch.

But my repo build is failed. https://ci.appveyor.com/project/decryp2kanon/bitcoin/builds/35602540
I will try again.
You've hit the 1hr limit. The Bitcoin Core appveyor jobs have been granted extra time which is why they work and personal jobs on the free plan don't.
I think they are happy to raise the time even for free projects. Our project used to be free as well, but we subscribed to the 2 build machine plan for OSS a while back.

> You've hit the 1hr limit. The Bitcoin Core appveyor jobs have been granted extra time which is why they work and personal jobs on the free plan don't.

how to get the extra time? i cannot test appveyor in my repo due to 1 hour limitation...

issue.title: [0.19] Backports
issue.body:
Backports the following to the 0.19 branch:
* https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/19194 - util: Don't reference errno when pthread fails. - not clean.
* https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/19536 - qt, build: Fix QFileDialog for static builds
* https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/19777 - docs: Correct description for getblockstats's txs field
* https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/19836 - rpc: Properly deserialize txs with witness before signing
* https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/20095 - CI: Bump vcpkg commit ID to get new msys mirror list
* https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/20141 - Avoid the use of abs64 in timedata
* https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/20142 - [0.20] build: set minimum required Boost to 1.48.0

issue.title: Update the vcpkg checkout commit ID in appveyor config
issue.body:
A recent appveyor vm update broke the build of the `berkeleydb` vcpkg dependency, see #19839. The temporary resolution was to switch back to the previous appveyor vm.

This PR updates the pegged vcpkg commit ID to the most recent commit as of 31 Aug 2020. That commit ID has been tested against the latest appveyor vm and is able to build Bitcoin Core successfully. 

The vcpkg bump includes a [patch](https://github.com/microsoft/vcpkg/pull/12870) to the `berkeleydb` build config which allows it to be built on the latest appveyor vm.
